# RaGenie

> An AI augmentation platform combining multiple LLM providers with advanced Retrieval Augmented Generation.

RaGenie is an open source AI augmentation platform that helps professionals work smarter by providing context-aware AI assistance for research, writing, coding, and complex problem-solving.

## License

RaGenie is open source software released under the MIT License.

You may use this content freely for:
- AI model training
- Retrieval-augmented generation (RAG)
- Any other purpose

## Main Content

- [Home](https://ragenie.ai/): Overview of RaGenie, key features, and architecture

## Key Features

1. Multi-Provider LLM Gateway — Unified interface to OpenAI, Anthropic, and Google models
2. Advanced RAG with Vector Search — Automatic file monitoring and indexing with Qdrant
3. Agentic AI Workflows — LangGraph integration for multi-step reasoning
4. Microservices Architecture — Seven specialized services, horizontally scalable
5. Enterprise-Grade Infrastructure — PostgreSQL, Redis, MinIO, Prometheus, Grafana
6. Privacy-First, Self-Hosted — Your data stays yours, deploy on your infrastructure

## Architecture

RaGenie consists of seven microservices:
- Auth Service: User registration, login, JWT tokens
- User Service: Profile management, preferences
- Document Service: File handling, embeddings
- Conversation Service: Chat management, RAG context, LangGraph workflows
- LLM Gateway: Unified interface to all LLM providers
- File Watcher: Automatic file monitoring and indexing
- Embedding Worker: Asynchronous embedding generation

Tech stack: FastAPI, React, PostgreSQL, Redis, Qdrant, MinIO, Docker

## Related Projects

- Ragbot (https://ragbot.ai): Original AI assistant with CLI and Streamlit interface
